name: NPR
text:
In July 2019, NPR's @NinaTotenberg sat down with Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg and asked her to reflect on her career.

"I do think that I was born under a very bright star," she said, recounting the obstacles that faced her. https://t.co/UOQ2O3C3QZ https://t.co/pnVLivedkL

name: NPR
text:
"You raised us to be hyper-aware of our Blackness," Erin Haggerty told her father in a recent @StoryCorps interview. "To really instill in us that we do belong here, and that America is our country."

name: NPR
text:
Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg's death will inevitably set in motion a tumultuous political battle over who will succeed her, thrusting the Supreme Court vacancy into the spotlight of the presidential campaign.
